message_history.content:
A conversation between User and Assistant. The user asks a question, and the Assistant answers it. The Assistant analyzes the given question and information in the mind, retains important relevant information, calls a search engine to find necessary information, accesses web pages with certain urls, and provides the user with the answer. The Assistant conducts search by <search> query </search>, access certain url by <access> url </access>, and the top search results and url page will be returned between <information> and </information>.  The reasoning processes are enclosed within <think> </think>. Finally, the Assistant provides answer inside <answer> and </answer>, i.e. <answer> answer here </answer>. If there are multiple queries, ensure all answers are enclosed within <answer> </answer>, seperated with comma. 

Note: the question is a valid question and you should try to find a correct answer. 

User: Help me collect the basic electoral information of 50 U.S. states in 2024. 1) the number of congressional districts; 2) number of electors; 3) the name of the governor in 2024 and his/her party affiliation, like "Gavin Newsom (D)"; 4) the names of the two senators in 2024 and their party affiliations separately.

Please present the information in one Markdown table with these column headers: State, Number of Congressional Districts, Number of Electors, Governor (Party), Senator 1 (Party) & Senator 2 (Party) 

Don't ask me any questions, just output the results according to the columns without omitting cells arbitrarily. The output format is ```markdown
{data_content}
```.

For example, 
```markdown
| State           | Number of Congressional Districts | Number of Electors | Governor (Party)     | Senator 1 (Party)& Senator 2 (Party) |
|-----------------|-----------------------------------|--------------------|----------------------|-------------------|-------------------|
| Alabama         | 7                                 | 9                  | Kay Ivey (R)         | Tommy Tuberville (R)& Katie Britt (R)   |

Assistant: 
<think>

To find the basic electoral information for each state in 2024, I'll search through reliable sources. </think>
<search> how many congressional districts in 2024 for each state </search>

Search query: how many congressional districts in 2024 for each state
Result: [Doc 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections):
2024 United States House of Representatives elections - Wikipedia ... House of Representatives elections were held on November 5, 2024 ... congressional districts in 30 states while the Democrats won a majority in 18 states.

[Doc 2](https://ballotpedia.org/United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections,_2024):
United States House of Representatives elections, 2024 - Ballotpedia As a result of the elections, Republicans won 220 districts, maintaining control of the chamber, while Democrats won 215 districts.

[Doc 3](https://www.census.gov/programs-surveys/geography/guidance/geo-areas/congressional-dist.html):
About Congressional Districts - U.S. Census Bureau After the apportionment of congressional seats among the states, which is based on decennial census population counts, each state with multiple ...

[Doc 4](https://www.britannica.com/topic/United-States-House-of-Representatives-Seats-by-State-1787120):
Number of U.S. House of Representatives Seats by State - Britannica How many representatives in the U.S. Congress does your state have? Use the map and table below to find out.

[Doc 5](https://www.270towin.com/2024-house-election/):
2024 House Election Interactive Map - 270toWin - 270 to Win Who will control the Congress? Review and predict the outcome of the 435 House races in the 2024 election.
I need specific numbers of congressional districts for each state. I'll focus my search to find that information first.

</think>
<search> how many congressional districts by state</search>

Search query: how many congressional districts by state
Result: [Doc 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_United_States_congressional_districts):
List of United States congressional districts - Wikipedia The number of voting seats within the House of Representatives is currently set at 435, with each one representing an average of 761,169 people following the ...

[Doc 2](https://www.census.gov/programs-surveys/geography/guidance/geo-areas/congressional-dist.html):
About Congressional Districts - U.S. Census Bureau Congressional districts are the 435 areas from which members are elected to the US House of Representatives.

[Doc 3](https://www.govtrack.us/congress/members/map):
Members of Congress & Congressional District Maps - GovTrack.us What congressional district are you in? Find your U.S. Congress senators and representative using a map.

[Doc 4](https://www.britannica.com/topic/United-States-House-of-Representatives-Seats-by-State-1787120):
Number of U.S. House of Representatives Seats by State | Britannica After the 2020 census, six states gained seats in the House: Colorado, Florida, Montana, North Carolina, and Oregon each gained one, and Texas gained two.

[Doc 5](http://www.house.gov/representatives):
Directory of Representatives - House.gov The number of voting representatives in the House is fixed by law at no more than 435, proportionally representing the population of the 50 states. Currently, ...
Now I'll search for the number of electors for each state, governor and his/her party affiliation, and the names of the two senators and their party affiliations for 2024.

</think>
<search> how many electors each state</search>

Search query: how many electors each state
Result: [Doc 1](https://www.archives.gov/electoral-college/allocation):
Distribution of Electoral Votes | National Archives Allocation among the States Electoral votes are allocated among the States based on the Census. Every State is allocated a number of votes equal to the ...

[Doc 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Electoral_College):
United States Electoral College - Wikipedia In the United States, the Electoral College is the group of presidential electors that is formed every four years for the sole purpose of voting for the ...

[Doc 3](https://www.usa.gov/electoral-college):
Electoral College | USAGov Counting of the electors' votes by Congress. In other U.S. elections, candidates are elected directly by popular vote. But the president and ...

[Doc 4](https://www.sos.alabama.gov/sites/default/files/election-data/Electoral%20College%20FAQ.pdf):
[PDF] The Electoral College - Alabama Secretary of State Every four years, voters elect a group of electors whose only purpose is to elect the president and vice president. This group of electors is known as the ...

[Doc 5](https://www.britannica.com/story/how-many-electoral-college-votes-does-each-us-state-have):
Electoral Votes by State | Infographic - Britannica Every U.S. presidential election is determined by the electoral college. Find out how many votes each state has. ... This infographic provides a list of the ...
I'll now search for the 2024 governor and his/her party affiliation and the 2024 senators and their party affiliations for each state.

</think>
<search> 2024 governor and his/her party affiliation</search>

Search query: 2024 governor and his/her party affiliation
Result: [Doc 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_current_United_States_governors):
List of current United States governors - Wikipedia The United States has 50 states and 5 territories that each elect a governor to serve as chief executive of the state or territorial government.

[Doc 2](https://governors.rutgers.edu/fast-facts-about-americas-governors/):
Fast Facts About America's Governors There are currently no Independent or third party governors in the U.S.. Partisan Control of Government. State Legislature. Governor, Democratic, Republican ...

[Doc 3](https://ballotpedia.org/Election_results,_2024:_Governors):
Election results, 2024: Governors - Ballotpedia 27 governors are Republicans and 23 are Democrats. In the states with gubernatorial elections in 2024, eight have Republican governors and three have a ...

[Doc 4](https://www.nga.org/governors/):
Current Governors - National Governors Association The National Governors Association provides informative gubernatorial resources, including current Governors' biographies and terms in office.

[Doc 5](https://www.ecs.org/2024-election-results-governors/):
2024 Election Results: Getting to Know Your Governors Three incumbents — Govs. Greg Gianforte in Montana, Spencer Cox in Utah and Phil Scott in Vermont — held onto their governorship ...
I'll search specifically for each state's governor and his/her party affiliation in 2024.

</think>
<search> kathy giuliani governor republican 2024</search>

Kathy Hochul - Ballotpedia Kathy Hochul (Democratic Party) is the Governor of New York. She assumed office on August 24, 2021. Her current term ends on January 1, 2027.

Two new contenders for the Republican gubernatorial nomination ... Pataki won a third term as governor in 2002. The primary election is in June and the general election will be in November 2022. Below is a ...

Governor of New York - Ballotpedia The governor is popularly elected every four years by a plurality and has no term limit. New York has a Democratic trifecta. The Democratic Party controls the ...

Andrew Giuliani - The New York Times Mr. Giuliani, who was campaigning for his son, Andrew, a Republican candidate for governor, said a man who hit him in the back said, “You're going to kill ...
I'll now search for the 2024 senators and their party affiliations for each state.

</think>

Result: [Doc 1](https://www.senate.gov/senators/Class_I.htm):
Class I - Senators Whose Term of Service Expire in 2031 Class I terms run from the beginning of the 119th Congress on January 3, 2025, to the end of the 121st Congress on January 3, 2031.

[Doc 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_United_States_Senate_elections):
2024 United States Senate elections Class 1 senators faced election in 2024. ... Republicans flipped four Democratic-held seats, regaining a Senate majority for the first time in four years, and the ...

[Doc 3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Classes_of_United_States_senators):
Classes of United States senators The 100 seats in the United States Senate are divided into three classes for the purpose of determining which seats will be up for election in any two-year ...

U.S. Senate Information about Current Senators. Party Division 119th Congress • Majority Party: Republicans (53 seats) • Minority Party: Democrats (45 seats)

[Doc 5](https://www.thegreenpapers.com/G25/SenateByClass.phtml):
2025 All-up chart of Senators by 'Class' All newly-elected/re-elected Senators who serve in the 119th Congress appear under 'Class 1'. Senators appearing in the 'Class 1' column were elected in 2024.
I need to find specific senators for each state. I'll search for 2024 senator names and their party affiliations for each state.

</think>
<search> 2024 senator alabama democratic</search>

Search query: 2024 senator alabama democratic
Result: [Doc 1](https://ballotpedia.org/List_of_United_States_Senators_from_Alabama):
List of United States Senators from Alabama - Ballotpedia The following candidates ran in the Republican primary for U.S. Senate Alabama on March 3, 2020. Candidate. %. Votes. ✓. Image of Tommy Tuberville.

Senate Leaders & Members | Alabama Legislature ... access legislative session information and the Code and Constitution of Alabama; and find your state Senators and Representatives.

[Doc 4](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_United_States_senators_from_Alabama):
List of United States senators from Alabama - Wikipedia Alabama was admitted to the Union on December 14, 1819. The state elects U.S. senators to class 2 and class 3. Its United States Senate seats were declared ...

[Doc 5](https://www.gbaa.biz/alabama-senators-and-representatives):
Alabama Senators & Representatives | GBAA Each state elects two senators for staggered 6-year terms. Senators represent the entire state. ALABAMA SENATORS. Tommy Tuberville. Republican.

</think>
